revised_title: Determination of the British Association Unit of Resistance in Absolute Measure
tldr: This paper describes an experiment by Lord Rayleigh, F.R.S., to determine the value of the British Association unit of resistance in absolute measure. The experiment involved using an improved apparatus and three distinct series of observations. The results showed a mean resistance of 23.612 (in units of 10^9 CGS) for the platinum-silver standard, with a resistance at 13' of 23.935 in terms of B.A. units, resulting in 1 B.A. unit equal to 0.98651 eM'th *.
